sub_title: Product designer and teacher healthcare innovations
summary:
In my latest years of experience I grew more towards designing digital products. My background in designing consumer products and health care innovations, gave me experience in a broad set of design disciplines and innovation methods.

Designing products for people with autism is a subject close to my heart as well as gamification, as both are user-centered and keeping people engaged is the focus.
I'm particularly interested in education, user research and design projects with social impact.

I'm always searching for and eagerly learning about trends, new technology and new ways for design to make everyday life challenges easier and more fun. Love to be one of the first owning a Kickstarter product even though I know the next version will be better :-)

How can I help you? Contact me for projects relating to:
Human-centered design, design for health  (especially autism) and design thinking/ design research methods.

projects.title: Autismspecs (autism experience)
projects.description:
Digital spectacles that enables the user to experience the world as if he would have autism. It is possible to adjust the settings to simulate different levels of visual and auditive experience of vision and sound affected by autism.
My input:
Supervision of internship students, usability testing of the prototype and tutorial video.

A secure platform for people with autism and their network packed with different apps like biography, (video) chat, forum, calendar, etc.

Concept design, usability testing, functionality (product backlogs), content management and forum moderation, service desk for technical matters and workshops/presentations of the products (autism healthcare 2.0).

authors.headline: Product designer and teacher healthcare innovations

profile_positions.description:
Designing and coordinating our minor program: Healthcare Innovation Design after four years teaching in our minor program Ergonomisch Ontwerpen.

Teacher at the department of Health Technology. With focus on human-centered design and product innovation for health care, ergonomics and design research. 

Lecturer on courses including: 
- human factors/ergonomics (physical, sensory and cognitive design of health care products)
- concept innovation
- gamification
- storytelling
- SolidWorks 3D software
- design thinking
- design research
- reverse engineering of health care products
profile_positions.title: Teacher Healthcare Technology

profile_positions.description:
Lecturer on courses including: 
- facilitating brainstorm sessions.
- design thinking courses (Think Better, Zig Zag, SIT, Product Phases).
- storytelling (Show and Tell).
- personal branding.
- creative tools (Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign).
- supervision of innovation projects and internship (models used: Ten Types of Innovation, Business Model Canvas, Value Proposition Design).
- applied research courses.
- creative thinking course in minor Innovation and Creativity.
profile_positions.title: Teacher Business Innovation

profile_positions.description: Researcher at Caring Society, research group Youth, Family & Society.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Heathcare Technology

profile_positions.description: Human-centered design, user experience/user interface design, gamification, product development, Wordpress websites.
profile_positions.title: Creative designer (owner)

company.name: Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen - Research group 'Levensloopbegeleiding bij autisme'

profile_positions.description: Evaluation study of two digital interventions (app and e-learning) in the education of students with autism.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
This research is done at the research group 'Levensloopbegeleiding bij autisme' at HAN University of Applied Sciences in Nijmegen.

Evaluation study of two digital interventions (app and e-learning) in the education of students with autism. The research is conducted at three schools: HAN (Hogeschool van Arnhem en Nijmegen), ROC Nijmegen and ROC Rijn IJssel. 

Six students from the HAN University of Applied Sciences graduated as part of this research under my supervision conducting interviews and literature study.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My experience of designing for people with autism include the following projects:

- Quli online healthcare platform
- Hows (serious game)
- BBox (autism experience)
- Autismspecs (autism experience)
- Studeercoach (app for students with autism)
- Blogger on apps for people with autism: www.autismeplein.nl and @autismeplein
